page.title: 04Conflict around Bubbenhall
page.content: {Farmers around the gravel and landfill sites are affected by rubbish carried by the wind eg.dormant seeds,and bones/litter caused by scavenging birds,especially crows.The litter is picked up by livestock causing sickness,even death.Mr.Webb has also been troubled by thistle and poppy seeds,but the company are helping in their control.Mr.Smith,however,has a more serious problem in the fluctuating level of his well.When Ryton Gravel Pits Lake was established as a permanent site,it was first lined with clay to keep the water level static.However,during the dry period summer 1983 to winter 1985,the water level continued to fall for no other known reason,hence the present monitoring.Gravel workings present a safety hazard as they tempt people to swim.Some fatalities have occurred.
